document.discussion_title: List of Republicans opposing Donald Trump for President, 2016
document.topic_text: List of Republicans opposing Donald Trump for President, 2016 From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia Jump to: navigation , search This is a list of notable Republicans who have announced their opposition to the election of Donald Trump , the 2016 Republican Party nominee, as the President of the United States . Contents State and territorial governors [ edit ] Current Larry Hogan , Maryland [7] Former Jeb Bush , Florida ; also former 2016 presidential candidate (refused to honor the signed GOP pledge to support the Republican nominee) [8] Susan Collins , U.S. Senator from Maine Current Robert Blackwill , Deputy National Security Advisor for Strategic Planning, The White House (endorsed Hillary Clinton ) [3] [2] Linda Chavez , Director of the Office of Public Liaison [5] Eric Edelman , Under Secretary of Defense for Policy; former National Security Advisor to the Vice President, The White House [2] Gary Edson , Deputy National Security Advisor, The White House [2] Scott Evertz , former Director of the Office of National AIDS Policy (endorsed Hillary Clinton ) [3] [2] Richard Falkenrath , Deputy Homeland Security Advisor, The White House [2] Peter Feaver , Senior Director for Strategic Planning, National Security Council, The White House [2] Tony Fratto , Deputy Assistant and Deputy Press Secretary to former President George W. Bush [23] Jendayi Frazer , Special Assistant to the President and Senior Director for African Affairs; former Assistant Secretary of State for African Affairs [2] Aaron Friedberg , Deputy National Security Advisor to the Vice President, The White House [2] David F. Gordon , Director of Policy Planning, Department of State [2] Michael Green , Special Assistant to the President and Senior Director for Asia, National Security Council, The White House [2] David A. Gross , U.S. Coordinator for International Communications and Information Policy (endorsed Hillary Clinton ) [3] [2] Paul Haenle , Director for China and Taiwan, National Security Council, The White House [2] John Hillen , Assistant Secretary of State for Political-Military Affairs [2] William Inboden , Senior Director for Strategic Planning, National Security Council, The White House [2] Reuben Jeffery III , Under Secretary of State for Economic Energy and Agricultural Affairs; former Special Assistant to the President for International Economic Affairs, National Security Council, The White House [2] James Jeffrey , Deputy National Security Advisor, The White House [2] Theodore Kassinger , Deputy Secretary of Commerce [2] David J. Kramer , Assistant Secretary of State for Democracy, Human Rights, and Labor [2]

Gordon , Director of Policy Planning, Department of State [2] Michael Green , Special Assistant to the President and Senior Director for Asia, National Security Council, The White House [2] David A. Gross , U.S. Coordinator for International Communications and Information Policy (endorsed Hillary Clinton ) [3] [2] Paul Haenle , Director for China and Taiwan, National Security Council, The White House [2] John Hillen , Assistant Secretary of State for Political-Military Affairs [2] William Inboden , Senior Director for Strategic Planning, National Security Council, The White House [2] Reuben Jeffery III , Under Secretary of State for Economic Energy and Agricultural Affairs; former Special Assistant to the President for International Economic Affairs, National Security Council, The White House [2] James Jeffrey , Deputy National Security Advisor, The White House [2] Theodore Kassinger , Deputy Secretary of Commerce [2] David J.
